results.title: Improving your posture
results.brief_description: Demonstrates several posture difficulties and shows various corrective exercises. Explains the skeletal and muscular systems and shows how bad posture affects health, comfort and appearance.

results.title: Impromptu
results.creator_credit: Sovereign Pictures, Governor Productions, Les Films Ariane, Stuart Oken, Daniel A. Sherkow and James Lapine
results.brief_description: Two lovers could never be more different than the cross-dressing, cigar-smoking writer George Sand (Judy Davis) and the frail, romantic Frederic Chopin (Hugh Grant). The greatest creative minds of all time - including Liszt (Julian Sands), Delacroix (Ralph Brown) and de Musset (Mandy Patinkin) come together for one wild fortnight. The lustful Marie d’Agoult (Bernadette Peters) decides to amuse herself and with her mischievous scheming there is no telling who will end up with who! The outcome is scandalous even by today’s standards - an outrageous sex farce that portrays the greatest geniuses with sexual appetites as powerful as their creative fervour. Co-starring Georges Corraface, Anton Rodgers and Emma Thompson.

results.title: Imprint = L'Empreinte
results.brief_description: A social and philosophical fable about a little boy who has a plank fastened to his back. The day it is taken off is a day of great relief. The boy then discovers that his body bears the mark of a shoe sole and heel.

results.title: Imprint = L'Empreinte
results.creator_credit: International Film Promotions, Jacques Armand Cardon and Henri Lacam
results.brief_description: Animated philosophical tale about the moulding of children into a social pattern. Futuristic piece which suggests that society will consist of two classes - the rulers and the ruled. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Impressions of Expo '67
results.brief_description: An invitation to Canada that all will want to see and many will wish to accept, presented in impressions of Expo 67 and of Montreal, the host city, at the liveliest and most exciting moment in its history.

results.title: Impressionism
results.brief_description: Discusses the unique qualities of impressionism and shows examples of impressionistic master-pieces. The techniques are contrasted with the detailed photographic techniques of some former schools. Points of departure are in the selection of everyday subjects, the use of intense contrasts of light and shadow and bold generalised patterns using heavy applications of paint to give great action and movement.

results.title: Impression of Oakleigh Technical School. . a caring place
results.brief_description: An overview of Oakleigh Technical School as seen throught the eyes of Scott, one of the students. The school is show as having a vibrant school council with an innovative, stimulating program.
